questions.text: Hawkeye is the only member of the regular cast who appears in this entire episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	This is the only episode of 'M*A*S*H' that features only a single member of the regular cast.  Alan Alda is also the only person to speak a word of English in the entire episode, which makes it doubly unique!

questions.text: Driving down a country road, Hawkeye suddenly finds himself involved in a jeep accident.  What causes this unfortunate incident?
questions.correct: He attempts to avoid some children running in the road
options: He crashes into an ox cart
His jeep is hit by a mortar shell
His jeep blows a tire, causing him to veer off the road
questions.explanation:
He attempts to avoid some children running in the road.

	Two children suddenly rush onto the road, right in front of Hawkeye's jeep.  In order to avoid them he takes a sharp turn and the jeep ends up on its side.  An injured and disoriented Hawkeye is helped into a local hut by the family that lives there.

questions.text: Where on his body has Hawkeye suffered a serious injury?
questions.explanation:
Head.

	Hawkeye alarmingly finds blood after surveying his scalp.  Suffering from symptoms such as an elevated pulse and profuse sweating, he believes that he has suffered a concussion.

questions.text: Believing himself to have suffered a concussion, Hawkeye decides that he must keep himself alert.  He does this by engaging the Korean family with whom he is staying in a one-way dialogue.  He begins by introducing his family history.  Hawkeye claims that his family has lived in what state since 1680?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	In a prior episode, Hawkeye claimed to have come from Vermont, but here he is firmly established as a resident of Maine.  He is proud of his heritage, and breaks out into patriotic song, singing 'Yankee Doodle Dandy', followed by a later reprise, but as 'Yankee Doodle Herring'.

questions.text: After smelling food that is cooking in the hut, Hawkeye is reminded of some of his favorite dishes.  What is the first food that comes to mind for Hawkeye?
questions.explanation:
Whitefish.

	Hawkeye claims to have enjoyed 'dissecting' whitefish during his off-time at medical school.  He desires a small piece of whitefish, or herring with sour cream and onions.  Hawkeye makes mention of a place called Sol and Sol's Delicatessen, where he ate many a delicious meal.

questions.text: Hawkeye addresses each of the members of the Korean family during his monologues, including the children.  While he is providing them with a blown-up latex glove as a toy, Hawkeye reveals the make-up of his own family.  Does he have any siblings?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Hawkeye is an only child, which contradicts an earlier episode when he claimed to have a sister.  Here, he claims that his parents stopped with him.  'I guess when they had me my parents decided not to 'sibble' anymore,' Hawkeye explains in his usual jocular manner.

questions.text: Hawkeye isn't exclusive to human beings, he even chats with the family ox for a few moments.  Hawkeye makes mention of the classic film 'Lost Horizon', which he assumes the ox has never seen.  Then he lists some great 'ox' movies.  Which of these is not amongst them?
questions.explanation:
Ox with the Wind.

	Hawkeye continues with 'Cow Green Was My Valley', but then says, 'Nah, that's cheap.'  Interestingly, Harry Morgan, who had recently been added as Colonel Potter during season four of 'M*A*S*H', was Henry Fonda's co-star in 'The Ox-Bow Incident'.

questions.text: In what big city does Hawkeye claim to have had a practice before he 'came to work for Harry Truman'?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	Hawkeye displays some Boston pride during his monologue.  He claims that all the great plays come through Boston first, before making their runs elsewhere.  Hawkeye claims to have seen 'Oklahoma', 'The King and I' and 'South Pacific' there.  He then sings a few lines from the 'South Pacific' tune 'Some Enchanted Evening'.

questions.text: Before he is finally located and returned to the 4077th, Hawkeye rhapsodizes earnestly about what body part 'that separates us from the other animals'?
questions.explanation:
Thumb.

	Hawkeye refers to the 'world famous opposible thumb' as a 'wondrous mechanism'.  He describes the important uses of the thumb in history, for example as the sign that a gladiator would live or die in ancient Rome, as a method of getting from one place to another - hitch-hiking and as a way to cradle someone's chin.  He then demonstrates his amazing skills with his thumbs by juggling.

questions.text: Hawkeye is finally rescued, and gratefully thanks the family for taking care of him in his ill condition.  Later, he returns to the family bearing gifts.  What mundane kitchen device does he give to the mother?
questions.explanation:
Cheese grater.

	To the children, he provides comic books and candy and to the father some tobacco, which is odd considering he is a doctor!  To the pregnant daughter, he provides his name and unit, so she can have professional medical care when the time comes to give birth. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it.
